intro: Calandrinia umbelliformis, commonly known as the clustered bluemink, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Mallow, characterized by its showy, pink or purple flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has hairy, succulent leaves and is often found in rocky or sandy soils.
